page.title: 02GEOLOGY AND ECOLOGY
page.content: 90% of the Edwinstowe area is{ {Bunter Sandstone}which is a bright orange sand deposited in desert conditions in{Permo-Triassic}times. In the valley of the {River Maun}is{Older {Alluvium}and in the South-East corner a Drift Deposit of{Glacial Sand and {Gravel.}The soils are weathered sandstones of poor quality. During dry,windy weather there are often serious{dust-storms}causing damage to crops and traffic hazards. The soil is low in fertility and drains rapidly so the most common crop {potatos}have to be {irrigated.}This is why much of the land is once again { {Forest}but this time{commercial pine {forest.}The natural vegetation is {Climax Oak Forest,Birchwoods and Open {Heathland.}Collieries have lowered the water table which has resulted in the death of many oak trees.
